title: Rome in the Bible (English)
description: Blueprint covering Rome’s biblical significance, verse clusters, prayer points, and TourLeadForm CTA.
content:
Rome’s detail text showcases verses about witness, persecution, and mission, aligning with the Verse Intelligence Block that covers perseverance and courage. The introduction points to Rome verses, links to Rome-related situations (boldness, justice), and gives the TourLeadForm as the affiliate CTA for ethically guided pilgrimages.

The body recommends prayer points for witnesses (witness prayer points), ties Rome back to Jerusalem and Nazareth itineraries, and includes a semantic-search mention so readers explore similar passages before booking.

The conclusion thanks visitors for stewarding the story, encourages sharing with their networks, and reaffirms that the tours support the €30K monthly revenue goal.
